Posts.Content: Oh thank goodness it's not only me with the ridge filled fingernails and discoloured,brittle,disformed toenails five months after finishing chemo...that stuff sure is toxic!Continued healing to all.
Posts.Title: 16 months post chemo and still nails coming off

Posts.Content: Hi Anniegirl1,thank you for your post I am so sorry that you had such an awful ordeal  whilst having your chemo,unfortunately some of the professionals that we rely on , so often let us down with their lack of basic humanity when doing their jobs! Like you I have had not good experiences with Letrozole and Tamoxifen at this point I am off all of them by choice and detoxifying my system using natural means.At no point do I advocate this route to others,but I do believe each to their own.So don't knock it until you've tried it eh? I commend you on looking and considering any means possible and wish you healing vibes for a full wholesome recovery on your journey.
Posts.Title: nearly 10 months out if chemo and still feeling poo :(

Posts.Content: 7 Weeks after my last Tax my left eye is still twitching like crazy,it hardly ever stops.!
Posts.Title: Weird side effects that no one tells you about!

Posts.Content: Yes  it's over the counter which is good. I certainly hope this combination continues to work and that it works for you also. Rozzie.
Posts.Title: Pain from Letrozole.

Posts.Content: I have been on Letrozole for awhile now,dealing with the pain in joints as a side effect and have tried several types of pain relief.A couple of weeks ago I took  Rapid Ibuprofen Lysine 342mg with the Paracetamol 2 tabs 3 times a day,and I must say the pain is 95% better I am so happy and just want to share this with everyone to see if it would work for you.I'm well on my way to being a true yogi in my class.
Posts.Title: Pain from Letrozole.

Posts.Content: Advise please if anyone has taken any of these during their treatment?
Posts.Title: Use of Probiotics and Dietary Supplements during Chemotherapy.

Posts.Content: Hi Rainbow Debs,Happy to hear you are getting Femara which is the best,I have tried 6 different brands all with horrible side effects,my local CCG ( who are probably not Macmillan savvy) will not allow GP's to prescribe Femera due to the cost so we have to make do with whichever brand you get monthly.After taking this drug now for 3 years I now have osteoporosis. The bottom line is cost,and I love the NHS and understand all the problems they are going through,but I would just like to feel a  little bit of love given to us,who have to take this drug to help prevent re-occurrence by letting us all have Femera.  Rozzie
Posts.Title: Letrozole - side effects and supplements

Posts.Content: Hi Helenshelagh,yes this chemo is a bitch it brings us to our knees,that's why you never get told the whole truth beforehand about how shite you feel! but you will Survive and it will become a memory albeit a not so good one,of course if you're like me and your memory capacity wrecked you might not remember the worst parts! Be good to yourself,let others do for you,watch all the tv you want to,stay in your onesies if you want to,don't apologise to others for feeling or looking like something the cat brought in!listen to good music dance in your chair ,laugh as much as you want to,and cry as much as you want to but at NO time feel sorry for yourself,when it's a lovely day go out or be taken out and embrace all the goodness that abounds,the universe will respond  to your wishes. Young Stephen Sutton was one of my inspirations last year when i was going thru hell,he said i have cancer but cancer doesn't have me!how great was that for an inspiring push? Healing hugs love and Light  to you.
Posts.Title: Struggling after forth chemo

Posts.Content: It's now 7 weeks after my Fec T chemo thank goodness that's over! However,my left upper and lower eyelids are constantly twitching,eyelashes started to grow back but have fallen out again has anyone else got these side effects? "I have cancer but it doesn't HAVE me."-Respect to Stephen Sutton.
Posts.Title: Side effects of chemo

Posts.Content: Hi chloecat 45, my oh my y haven't I come across your posts before?so uplifting!thanks,I love how you question all possibilities,I did go down the conventional route with my treatment and at times I have intervened,esp during chemotherapy when full on doses nearly finished me off! learning to listen to my inner voice is also helping with this challenge.I was just changed from letrozole to tamoxifen a few days ago and today my whole being let me know that it's not right,so back to the drawing board for me and my doctors!If you have any pearls regarding the oestrogen blocking of our systems please share with me,I ave read up a lot on adjusting the diet in this regard.Thanks.
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi CC45, Thanks so much for the info,so on my wavelength! I am a registered nurse myself and used to work in oncology I was so surprised during my journey at the dismissive attitude of some of my treatment specialists to even letting me voice my opinion as to the treatment plan,it was quite a downer!But I persisted,as I tune into my body as much as possible now,and listen to it , I seek any healthy doable alternative to help in its healing. This cancer has been my greatest teacher,so many lessons learnt and more to  come. Sing,Dance,Praise,Mercy,Believe,Love,Gratitude.beat your drum.
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi SaxxyD, Great to see your wonderful talent and so good to see someone who has found a new passion.I am in class of 2013,now 4 months after radiation. I am unable to do nursing now this was my passion for 43 yrs. I am now trying to find a new passion to feel relevant! as i am not a quitter! All the best with your great art and continued healing.
Posts.Title: Life does go on

Posts.Content: Hi Karan,this is indeed an anxious time,after my mastectomy and before my chemo I had to have a cyst removed on my liver happy that it was benign,but I was told that all abnormalities have to be checked as it impacts on the whole treatment plan.Stay positive and believe that it will all be for the best.Healing hugs.
Posts.Title: In need of some reassuring words!

Posts.Content: It's silly o'clock and I am plagued with a relentless post nasal drip cough!I cough every 15 seconds ,my voice has completely gone,I get no sleep and I am beside myself! I got this cough a few days after being hospitalised with neutrophils with my first cycle of Dec.please post if anyone has had a similar experience,I am going out of my mind!!
Posts.Title: Coughs !

Posts.Content: That should read neutropenia and FEC
Posts.Title: Coughs !

Posts.Content: Thanks GillieB,yes candy crush n catchup tv helps,I find myself apologizing to everyone for this cough as I think it keeps them awake also! Lol!
Posts.Title: Coughs !
